body: @StephanEwenI've added try/catch statement. Mind looking to PR once again?
Thanks for the review @TisonKun and @zentol. Merging this PR once Travis gives green light (after rebasing).

I think this needs input from @tillrohrmann.
AFAIK this is intentionally still in there as long as the legacy mode is still supported
How about adding a method `allocateUnpooledOffHeapMemory` to the factory?

- [X] Consensus that the contribution should go into to Flink
    - +1 from my side, change makes sense
  - [X] Does not need specific attention
  - [X] Contribution description
  - [X] Architectural approach
  - [X] Overall code quality

Optional minor change, but no blockers
If existing savepoints have an AbstractID serialized in it, will the deserialization fail if that field changes?

Concerning the other method you mentioned: That one is never used on the critical path, so things may be different there.

Catching the null value earlier may be a more clean fix even. But again, we should not introduce branches if avoidable.

Thanks for your reviews! @StephanEwen

That is a good idea for adding `allocateUnpooledOffHeapMemory` in the factory, so it can also make easy for using in `MemoryManager` and `NetworkBufferPool`. I already update the codes.

cc @tillrohrmann @StephanEwen could you help advance this PR?
Thanks.
I have pushed fixup commit
@yanghua @tillrohrmann Could you please review this pr?

Thanks for the update @pnowojski.
I have no preference regarding adding or dropping "User-Defined". 

+1 to merge once that question is resolved.
@pnowojski I have updated the PR. Please review again, thanks.
@pnowojski If you have time, you can also help me to review this PR. thanks.
@xccui I also fixed the conflicts, please review it when you have time.
Let's delay this until the legacy mode was removed.

Thank you @fhueske and @dawidwys for your reviews. I hope I could address all of them. I also rebased the PR. I just saw that the PR still removes some unrelated class. I will out this in a hotfix commit when merging.
@buptljy Could you please take a look at the pr.

Hi @tillrohrmann , I am not sure should we make MetricQueryService as a RpcEndpoint in this fix. I reused the RpcService to create another Actor system, and JobManager get the actor address through the TaskExecutor Gateway. The commit messages explains the implementation in detail.

Thanks for your review! @StefanRRichter  @StephanEwen @zentol 
I agree to delay this. Could I keep this PR open and ping here on the removal done?
Great work. This would be much more explicit.
@twalthr can you check the latest fixup commit?
Yes, I was planning to after merging the `cosh` PR :) Before I take a look, could you also apply the same changes that I asked for `cosh` to this one (if appropriate).
OK, will update it based on the PR of `cosh`.
Thanks a lot for your review @StefanRRichter. I agree that instantiating the `ClusterComponent` in an eager way is a good improvement. I'll add another commit for that.

I would close this PR until the blockers are resolved in order to reduce the noise in the PR list. Since you still have the code available it should not have any effect on you and you can link this PR from your future PR.

Furthermore, I would update this ticket to indicate that it is blocked by [FLINK-10392](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FLINK-10392) (or as an alternative, make it a subtask of [FLINK-10392](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/FLINK-10392) and say that it should be addressed last)
@uce ok~ thanks for your education
@TisonKun, yes we want to support Hadoop 2.4.x with the new mode as well. We just have not tested it because we needed to keep the legacy mode tested and did not want to explode the build/test time.
Thanks for the review @StefanRRichter and @TisonKun. Merging this PR.
Thanks for the review @TisonKun & @zentol. Merging this PR.
@tillrohrmann thanks for the clarification

Thanks again for the review @zentol. I had to add the `IdleStateHandler` because it happened sometimes in `RestClientTest#testConnectionClosedHandling` that the channel would not be closed by Netty after we closed the server socket. So sometimes Netty detects such an event and then calls `channelInactive` and sometimes not. For the latter case, we need to monitor the connection for idleness.
Thanks for the review @StefanRRichter. Addressing your comment and then merging this PR.
urgh, well that's unfortunate. We may want to increase the idle timeout to a larger value though (maybe 5 minutes?), as it effectively is an upper limit for the timeout that a user may specify.
I have almost all of the comments (or wrote reply if not). Can you check the revised PR?
Thanks for the review @StefanRRichter.
Yes, I will increase the idleness timeout to 5 minutes. Merging this PR then.
Thanks for the review @azagrebin, @GJL and @shuai-xu. Merging this PR once Travis gives green light.
@pnowojski I have refactored this PR's documentation.
ping @StephanEwen what is the following step? I am confused that it stalls.
I agree with @TisonKun. Removing the `EXECUTION_MODE_OPTION` and `isNewMode` can be done in another subtask of FLINK-10392.
@TisonKun @StefanRRichter will this PR be merged into master edition?
@StephanEwen , i have changed the implementation with java annotation, could you take a look?
cc @TisonKun @yanghua
@pnowojski I also changed this PR based on your suggestion for the `cosh`
cc @xccui @yanghua

@lzqdename From my side this pull request goes the right direction and now it is ready to be merged.

However, I am not a committer who has the right to merge you PR. What I can do is show my approval and ping some committers for you to ask for a review/decision.

Please note that ASF [states that](http://www.apache.org/dev/contributors#patches):

"""
Please show some patience with the developers if your patch is not applied as fast as you'd like or a developer asks you to make changes to the patch. If you do not receive any feedback in a reasonable amount of time (say a week or two), feel free to send a follow-up e-mail to the developer list. Open Source developers are all volunteers, often doing the development in their spare time.
"""

Thank you very much,and maybe next week I will make the second PR to flink
Thank you all the same !

@dawidwys It doesn't matter, my current approach is to exclude related classes, Travis will turn green, but there may be other ways to deal with them. In fact, the original API is still available, I just added a few overloaded APIs.
@StefanRRichter can you review it?
@pnowojski Can you also review this PR?
Thank you for your review @yanghua @TisonKun. I have add two commits correspondingly.

@TisonKun Unfortunately, I'm not familiar with this part of the code base and don't feel comfortable with merging this. As I don't have the context for this PR, my opinion would be to close this without merging (as well as corresponding ticket) as the CLI is not a performance-critical part of the code while the change might easily introduce a bug. Let me reiterate that I mostly say this, because I'm not familiar with this code. If there is another committer that is, it might be obvious to merge this PR.
@uce I understand your concerned and sorry to involve you here.
@Clarkkkkk when you rebase the PR, please use `git pull --rebase`. This command will let git ignore the automatic message like `Merge branch 'master' into xxx`
@fhueske hi, Stephan mentioned you in the email reply to me, let me find you help, I don't know if you have time to discuss this jira, but I still look forward to your reply.
Please also rebase onto the latest master if possible.
Merging
also updated the documentation.
also updated this PR's documentation
@tillrohrmann and @pnowojski any suggestion?

@tillrohrmann I have refactored and rebased this PR. I found the original `retrieveJobGraph ` method in `StandaloneJobClusterEntrypoint ` has been moved into `ClassPathJobGraphRetriever` (introduced 
 in PR #6743 ). So I moved my changes into the `ClassPathJobGraphRetriever#retrieveJobGraph`. Hope it matches your expect.
@fhueske @StephanEwen could you help to have a look?

cc @StefanRRichter 
I  use 5 threads for downloading files, because I think 5 is enough for  a lot of scenarios, and from the experience of my company using 5 threads looks good.

Is there anyone knows why the '/bin/sh -c apk add --no-cache bash snappy' fails? I am not very familiar with Docker.
CC @tillrohrmann @StephanEwen @twalthr @zentol @TisonKun @yanghua
I've met this failure several times, but have no idea of it. Same, I am not familiar with Docker.

hi @azagrebin, 
any idea when this will be merged ? in 1.6.2 ? or it will wait 1.7.0 ?
@Clarkkkkk thanks for your review!
Thank you @dawidwys. Travis gave green light. I will merge this...

Hi @SuXingLee, thank you very much for your contribution. I think having a table sink for file system would be a great feature. However I think we should use the new `StreamingFileSink`, on which the community is working for some time already, for this purpose. This new connector is fixing a few problems with the old one, that's why it will probably replace the `BucketingSink` at some point. 

To sum up I think we should use the `StreamingFileSink` rather than `BucketingSink` here.

It requires much than just switching to `StreamingFileSink`. Every new sink should integrate with the new unified API. See also https://github.com/apache/flink/pull/6611 for an example. The formats for should be pluggable and integrated with SQL.
Thanks for the comments! Will merge.

Please see also my comment on the Jira issue. Before adapting the PR, we should agree on the feature scope and design. Please provide a design document and continue the discussion on Jira issue. 
I think this PR should be closed because it needs to be completely rewritten.
cc @kl0u @pnowojski

Hi @bmeriaux, we can merge it after @zentol's comments are resolved. We usually merge new features or functionality into the new releases unless there is good reason to port to bug fix releases. I suggest to update to 1.7 in future to use new Cassandra connectors. There should be good compatibility between 1.6 and 1.7. We can discuss it if there is any problem with not having Cassandra updates in 1.6.

@yanghua I would assume that deadlocking/becoming unresponsive just proves that our `at-least-once` test is broken and should be replaced. Feel free to disable it for your `2.0.0` version.

Keep in mind that the idea is to use our 2.0 connector, to talk to all Kafka versions from 0.11+. That requires some additional testing and refactoring of our existing testing code base. So far we were testing `flink-connector-kafka-0.11` against only a single kafka version (`0.11`). Now, we might need to test our `flink-connector-kafka-2.0` against Kafka `0.11`, `1.0`, `1.1` and `2.0`.

The build files wouldn't be really be simpler; we will still need a jdk9 profile regardless.
I've found too many threads on google where users had issues which could be resolved by adding the `jdk.tools` dependency to consider this a 100% safe change.

Since the degree of simplification is questionable and there are otherwise no benefits to generally excluding the dependency the risks far exceed the rewards. If even a single person is inconvenienced by this it already wasn't worth it.

I will merge the PR as is.

Let's move the discussion for moving hadoop to `flink-shaded` into a dedicated JIRA since it will just get lost here.
@Xpray do you think you find time to update this PR?
@yanghua Sorry, for the delay. I will take a look at it soon. I want to think about our general design for views before.
@pnowojski Ok, what I am currently doing is removing the cascading dependencies in flink-connector-kafka-2.0. And verify the correctness of this step.
@twalthr and @pnowojski , This PR took so long, please help with the final review.
@pnowojski can you review and merge this PR? Thanks.

Thanks for review, @twalthr . I also think that it would be best if calcite could support << and >>, however I am not sure whether calcite could support this very well for two reason, one is that it looks bitwise shift operation is not sql standard and from [HIVE-9859](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HIVE-9859) discussion it looks that ">>" has potential conflicts with nested complex type declaration in hive which also uses calcite.
So maybe there are two ways:
1. As you said make calcite suport this.
2. Since [Spark](https://spark.apache.org/docs/2.3.0/api/sql/index.html#shiftleft) and [Hive](https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/Hive/LanguageManual+UDF) both have shiftleft and shiftright, maybe we could also add this named as shiftleft and shiftright...

Thanks
@twalthr I'll update this PR in two days. Best.

Excellent!  

I'm currently working on adding support for Scala 2.12, and this PR is a prerequisite for that, since it makes it easier to remove older Kafka connectors from the Scala 2.12 build. The reason for this is that there are no Scala 2.12 dependencies for Kafka version < 0.10.2.x

hi @klion26, do I understand correctly that the idea now is that the state descriptor is serialised and sent for every request? If so it is probably too expensive to do it every time. The check could happen only once.
I'm currently preparing an asm6 version for `flink-shaded` since we also need it for java 9 compatibility.
Note that the GitHub link for the version you're using results in a 404.
For `flink-shaded-asm` it would be useful to know which components of asm are actually required.

@dawidwys I looked at the code again and I think it's good to merge. It's a serious bug when it comes to exactly-once sinks.

Could you please also check and merge it on 1.5.x and 1.6.x so that we release the fix when we release new versions of these branches?
@zentol @mxm thanks, I incorporated your suggestions. PTAL

@zentol that was resolved by one of the last commits. The problem was that our exclusion pattern for `anon$$...` classes was not correct.
@aljoscha I'm not aware of any changes in the meantime which could break things. I think this is the task of the reviewer to guarantee that this is not the case.
